00037 #define MAX_STRING_SIZE 128

00039 extern int ldlm_srv_namespace_nr;
00040 extern int ldlm_cli_namespace_nr;
00041 extern struct mutex ldlm_srv_namespace_lock;
00042 extern struct list_head ldlm_srv_namespace_list;
00043 extern struct mutex ldlm_cli_namespace_lock;
00044 extern struct list_head ldlm_cli_active_namespace_list;
00045 extern struct list_head ldlm_cli_inactive_namespace_list;
00046 extern unsigned int ldlm_cancel_unused_locks_before_replay;
00047 
00048 static inline int ldlm_namespace_nr_read(enum ldlm_side client)
00049 {
00050         return client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER ?
00051                 ldlm_srv_namespace_nr : ldlm_cli_namespace_nr;
00052 }
00053 
00054 static inline void ldlm_namespace_nr_inc(enum ldlm_side client)
00055 {
00056         if (client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER)
00057                 ldlm_srv_namespace_nr++;
00058         else
00059                 ldlm_cli_namespace_nr++;
00060 }
00061 
00062 static inline void ldlm_namespace_nr_dec(enum ldlm_side client)
00063 {
00064         if (client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER)
00065                 ldlm_srv_namespace_nr--;
00066         else
00067                 ldlm_cli_namespace_nr--;
00068 }
00069 
00070 static inline struct list_head *ldlm_namespace_list(enum ldlm_side client)
00071 {
00072         return client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER ?
00073                 &ldlm_srv_namespace_list : &ldlm_cli_active_namespace_list;
00074 }
00075 
00076 static inline
00077 struct list_head *ldlm_namespace_inactive_list(enum ldlm_side client)
00078 {
00079         return client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER ?
00080                 &ldlm_srv_namespace_list : &ldlm_cli_inactive_namespace_list;
00081 }
00082 
00083 static inline struct mutex *ldlm_namespace_lock(enum ldlm_side client)
00084 {
00085         return client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER ?
00086                 &ldlm_srv_namespace_lock : &ldlm_cli_namespace_lock;
00087 }
00088 
00089 /* ns_bref is the number of resources in this namespace */
00090 static inline int ldlm_ns_empty(struct ldlm_namespace *ns)
00091 {
00092         return atomic_read(&ns->ns_bref) == 0;
00093 }

00096                                           enum ldlm_side);

00098                                             enum ldlm_side);

00101 /* ldlm_request.c */
00102 /* Cancel lru flag, it indicates we cancel aged locks. */
00103 enum ldlm_lru_flags {
00104         LDLM_LRU_FLAG_AGED      = 0x01, /* Cancel aged locks (non LRU resize) */
00105         LDLM_LRU_FLAG_PASSED    = 0x02, /* Cancel passed number of locks */
00106         LDLM_LRU_FLAG_SHRINK    = 0x04, /* Cancel locks from shrinker */
00107         LDLM_LRU_FLAG_LRUR      = 0x08, /* Cancel locks from lru resize */
00108         LDLM_LRU_FLAG_NO_WAIT   = 0x10, /* Cancel locks w/o blocking (neither
00109                                          * sending nor waiting for any RPCs) */
00110         LDLM_LRU_FLAG_LRUR_NO_WAIT = 0x20, /* LRUR + NO_WAIT */
00111 };
00112

00118                           enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags,
00119                           enum ldlm_lru_flags lru_flags);

00235 /* interval tree, for LDLM_EXTENT. */
00236 extern struct kmem_cache *ldlm_interval_slab; /* slab cache for ldlm_interval */
00237 extern void ldlm_interval_attach(struct ldlm_interval *n, struct ldlm_lock *l);
00238 extern struct ldlm_interval *ldlm_interval_detach(struct ldlm_lock *l);
00239 extern struct ldlm_interval *ldlm_interval_alloc(struct ldlm_lock *lock);
00240 extern void ldlm_interval_free(struct ldlm_interval *node);
00241 /* this function must be called with res lock held */
00242 static inline struct ldlm_extent *
00243 ldlm_interval_extent(struct ldlm_interval *node)
00244 {
00245         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00246         LASSERT(!list_empty(&node->li_group));
00247 
00248         lock = list_entry(node->li_group.next, struct ldlm_lock,
00249                               l_sl_policy);
00250         return &lock->l_policy_data.l_extent;
00251 }

00259         LDLM_POLICY_SKIP_LOCK
00260 };

00262 #define LDLM_POOL_PROC_READER_SEQ_SHOW(var, type)                       \
00263         static int lprocfs_##var##_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)\
00264         {                                                               \
00265                 struct ldlm_pool *pl = m->private;                      \
00266                 type tmp;                                               \
00267                                                                         \
00268                 spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);                                \
00269                 tmp = pl->pl_##var;                                     \
00270                 spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);                              \
00271                                                                         \
00272                 return lprocfs_uint_seq_show(m, &tmp);                  \
00273         }                                                               \
00274         struct __##var##__dummy_read {;} /* semicolon catcher */
00275 
00276 #define LDLM_POOL_PROC_WRITER(var, type)                                \
00277         static int lprocfs_wr_##var(struct file *file,                  \
00278                              const char __user *buffer,                 \
00279                              unsigned long count, void *data)           \
00280         {                                                               \
00281                 struct ldlm_pool *pl = data;                            \
00282                 type tmp;                                               \
00283                 int rc;                                                 \
00284                                                                         \
00285                 rc = lprocfs_wr_uint(file, buffer, count, &tmp);        \
00286                 if (rc < 0) {                                           \
00287                         CERROR("Can't parse user input, rc = %d\n", rc);\
00288                         return rc;                                      \
00289                 }                                                       \
00290                                                                         \
00291                 spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);                                \
00292                 pl->pl_##var = tmp;                                     \
00293                 spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);                              \
00294                                                                         \
00295                 return rc;                                              \
00296         }                                                               \
00297         struct __##var##__dummy_write {;} /* semicolon catcher */
00298 
00299 static inline void
00300 ldlm_add_var(struct lprocfs_vars *vars, struct proc_dir_entry *proc_dir,
00301              const char *name, void *data, const struct file_operations *ops)
00302 {
00303         snprintf((char *)vars->name, MAX_STRING_SIZE, "%s", name);
00304         vars->data = data;
00305         vars->fops = ops;
00306         lprocfs_add_vars(proc_dir, vars, NULL);
00307 }
00308 
00309 static inline int is_granted_or_cancelled(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00310 {
00311         int ret = 0;
00312 
00313         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00314         if ((lock->l_req_mode == lock->l_granted_mode) &&
00315              !ldlm_is_cp_reqd(lock))
00316                 ret = 1;
00317         else if (ldlm_is_failed(lock) || ldlm_is_cancel(lock))
00318                 ret = 1;
00319         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00320 
00321         return ret;
00322 }
